context: During a recent security incident, ransomware behavior was detected on the host `vnevado-win11u` with AadDeviceId `bc00e484-d0e5-4da4-9472-95568cccc07e`. This incident involved suspicious file system changes which are indicative of potential ransomware activity. Further investigation identified suspicious remote activity, and subsequent lateral movement to the jump server `Vnevado-jump` using PSExec. The host was later detected with unknown malware that was active, which Windows Defender might have blocked.
question: What is the name of the file associated with the unknown malware detected on the host `vnevado-win11u`?
solution_steps: Suspicious file system changes indicating potential ransomware activity were detected, involving a host with AadDeviceId `bc00e484-d0e5-4da4-9472-95568cccc07e`.
Suspicious remote activity was observed from IP address `99.83.111.100`.
Lateral movement was detected with PSExec to the jump server, involving an account with SID `S-5-7-21-1843151660-3234030288-105586167-1422`.
An unknown malware named `mimikatz.exe` was detected and was active on the host.
